Swindon North deserves an MP who puts the people first and works all year round. I promise you that I will always put the residents' needs before my own and will continue to work tirelessly for the people of Swindon.
For the past 12 years North Swindon has been underrepresented. I will do everything within my power to ensure the residents of Swindon North are heard nationally.
The Swindon North community is so important to me. I will continue to work alongside and support community organisations. I will also continue my community action days across Swindon North.

Swindon North's MP!
Swindon North's MP!
I was born and raised in Swindon, I have lived in the town for 32 years. I grew up in the Pinehurst area and went to Headlands school.
After leaving, I worked various jobs from factories to call centres, but it wasn't for me so I decided to take a leap and join the army in the 1st Battalion the rifles. I absolutely loved my time in the army but after 5 years I decided to leave to set up a small business in Swindon.
It was at this point that I got involved in politics and joined the Labour Party. After being heavily involved in local campaigning, I stood for parish council and then borough, winning both seats.
I am so proud to be the local MP and represent the people of Swindon, I love working towards improving the residents' lives through community engagement and being active across Swindon North.
